The Safe Water Syndrome

UV is different from chlorine in disinfecting water. Chlorine reacts with naturally-occurring organic matter in water and forms chloroform, which is a carcinogen. Not to mention, chlorine leaves behind a foul taste and smell to water. Ultra violet water purifiers leave behind only clean, fresh tasting and smelling water and they do this without chemicals.

Even advanced methods of treatment in residential areas or municipal corporations will not help in getting rid of the contaminants fully. It is therefore a necessity to get the water purified.
uv water purifiers - these are expensive devices that use ultra-violet light to kill bacteria, mold, algae, yeast and other microorganisms at the water source. Again, these systems do not deal with chemicals or heavy metals in your water, so you will still need a filter in addition to the UV water purifier.
The manner in which uv water filters work is unique and indeed interesting. The UV water filters do not exactly kill the Microorganisms in the water, but rather changes their basic DNA strands, thus rendering then unable to reproduce or regenerate. So, the UV water filters make the harmful bacteria in the water inactive or non pathogenic and your water is safe to drink. A very positive facet of UV water filters is the fact that it does not alter the basic chemistry of the water and thus the water retains its taste and beneficial minerals.

The wiring should be rated to carry the measured solar amperage plus 50% to avoid power loss. For instance, a 140 watt solar panel generates about 8 amps and requires cable rated to carry 12 amps.
With the cost of electricity rising everyday people are looking out for new and cheap energy sources to power their homes. Solar power is gaining popularity these days. Since it is available freely in nature you do not have to pay anything for using it. Unlike other sources it does not cause any pollution either. So most of the homeowners are slowly considering the use of solar energy for powering their appliances. If you wish to make use of this green power you need to have solar panels for your home to absorb and store the energy. You can use the panels to store the energy and use it for powering certain home appliances in place of using electricity.
Since a solar power system is actually rated in watts, to figure output amps, simply divide the wattage rating of the panels by 15. So a typical 5-watt panel would give you a maximum output of .33 amps a day. Because of the fact that the highest rate output occurs when the sun is directly overhead, expect an average rated output of about 5 hours a day. Thus, the 5-watt panel would give approximately 1.65 amp hours (5 x 0.33).

The Dangers Of Reverse Osmosis Drinking Water Exposed

This type of system usually requires a pre-treatment system that removes chlorine from the water supply since that can be very damaging to the delicate membrane of the reverse osmosis water filter system.
Things get even more backwards, considering that it withholds natural minerals that can be beneficial to the body. Water naturally contains these trace minerals (i.e. calcium, magnesium, potassium, etc.), essential for our health, and without them we lack proper nutrition and even risk cancer.
Water treatment centers use reverse osmosis to remove mineralized or seeable debris from our water, but without further filtering for chemicals, metals, and parasites, the system doesnt render water safe to drink. If a treatment facility cant get the job done using the same equipment, what would lead you to believe that a home reverse osmosis system is going to do any better?
A typical countertop RO unit wastes lots of water. To produce a gallon of pure water, it wastes nearly four gallons of water. This, needless to say, is terribly bad for the environment. Water is a precious commodity and it is meant to be treated like one.
The most durable and the most effective of the units waste water at an astounding rate, but the fact is that the more efficient models, while wasting less water, may not be sufficient at effectively cleaning your water.

Although some people with city water feel strongly that theyd prefer a reverse osmosis system, its really more appropriate for those whose water comes from a well. That is because well water contains high levels of calcium and magnesium. In order to soften the water, sodium is used to replace calcium and magnesium. Reverse osmosis can be used to remove the sodium and improve the waters taste.
